lead_paragraph: During an extraordinary news conference, the leaders’ exchanges underscored how far the two nations have to travel to fully restore relations.

byline.original: By JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS and DAMIEN CAVE

headline.print_headline: A ‘New Day’ of Openness, Taxed by Old Grievances
headline.main: Cuba Meeting Between Obama and Castro Exposes Old Grievances

snippet: During an extraordinary news conference, the leaders’ exchanges underscored how far the two nations have to travel to fully restore relations.
abstract: Pres Obama, in Cuba for his first meeting with Pres Raul Castro, engages in open and at times awkward exchange during 55-minute news conference; leaders trade criticism of each others' countries, particular in regard to human rights, and bring up old grievances, underscoring how far two nations have to go to fully restore relations.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
